ch.bfh.ti.ostes2.gossip

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.ostes2.gossip.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    A class providing various helper functions for time stamps as well as definitions of tags used for communication of Messages.
    Author:
    sosterwalder

      static int[] getMaximizedTimestamp(int[] timestampOne, int[] timestampTwo)
      Returns the (component-wise) maximum of two given time stamps, assuming that the time stamps have the same length.

      Returns the (component-wise) minimum of two given time stamps, assuming that the time stamps have the same length.

      Checks if the first provided time stamp is smaller or equal as the second provided time stamp, assuming that the time stamps have the same length.
      static int[] mergeTimestamps(int[] timestampOne, int[] timestampTwo)

    • Method Detail

      • isSmallerOrEqualThan

        public static final boolean isSmallerOrEqualThan(int[] timestampOne,
                           int[] timestampTwo)
        Checks if the first provided time stamp is smaller or equal as the second provided time stamp, assuming that the time stamps have the same length. E.g.: ts1: [2, 3] ts2: [5, 1] => res: false (3 > 1)
        Parameters:
        timestampOne - the target time stamp
        timestampTwo - the source time stamp
        Returns:
        true if timestampOne is smaller or equal, otherwise false

      • getMaximizedTimestamp

        public static final int[] getMaximizedTimestamp(int[] timestampOne,
                          int[] timestampTwo)
        Returns the (component-wise) maximum of two given time stamps, assuming that the time stamps have the same length. E.g.: ts1: [2, 3] ts2: [5, 1] => res: [5, 3]
        Parameters:
        timestampOne -
        timestampTwo -
        Returns:
        the maximum out of the two time stamps

      • getMinimizedTimestamp

        public static final int[] getMinimizedTimestamp(int[] timestampOne,
                          int[] timestampTwo)
        Returns the (component-wise) minimum of two given time stamps, assuming that the time stamps have the same length. E.g.: ts1: [2, 3] ts2: [5, 1] => res: [2, 1]
        Parameters:
        timestampOne -
        timestampTwo -
        Returns:
        the minimum out of the two time stamps

      • mergeTimestamps

        public static final int[] mergeTimestamps(int[] timestampOne,
                    int[] timestampTwo)
        Merges two given time stamps to their maximal value, assuming that the time stamps have the same length. E.g.: ts1: [2, 3] ts2: [5, 1] => res: [5, 3]
        Parameters:
        timestampOne -
        timestampTwo -
        Returns:
        the maximum out of the two time stamps
